text:
I get this wierd error when i try to implement to_index with a struct:
<http://Base.to|Base.to>_index(s::State) = CartesianIndex(s.x,s.y)

When i try to use it it throws
 "getindex for Array{Float64,2} with types Tuple{CartesianIndex{2}} is not supported"

elements.text: I get this wierd error when i try to implement to_index with a struct:

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56503| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
If you want to generate more than a single integer, you need to use the more complicated `to_indices` instead
